data.text: Shimano RX8s we‚Äôre my favorite for a while. Tried those with XT pedals and gave up my Giro Empire SLXs and Speedplays for the SPD solution. The RX8s are seriously lightweight and perfectly stiff for an SPD shoe. I‚Äôve since switched to Bont Riots, which are more comfortable, but just slightly heavier. They‚Äôre a little stiffer, which I‚Äôm not as happy with on the MTB, but they‚Äôre great for gravel and road.

data.text: Depending on your riding, three-bolt road shoes can be a great option if weight and comfort is most important. I ride in Giro Empires on gravel all the time and they are great for me. I have narrow feet and prefer powering through climbs over hike a bike routes
data.author: Chris McQueen
